alert.note: Alert for Bexar (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 31 at 6:43PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Bexar and southwestern Comal Counties through 730 PM CDT... At 643 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Smithson Valley, or 10 miles north of Selma, moving west at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... New Braunfels, Schertz, Canyon Lake, Bulverde, Garden Ridge, Guadalupe River State Park, Smithson Valley, Timberwood Park, Spring Branch, Anhalt, Honey Creek State Natural Area and Specht Store. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
